definition: way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: She gives anequivocal answer, typical of a politician.
sentences.chinese: 她給出的答案模棱兩可，是典型的政客做派。

sentences.english: Telling all is the American way.
sentences.chinese: 全盤托出那是美國人的做派。

sentences.english: In turn, they disparaged our elitism and urban mores.
sentences.chinese: 相應的，他們也蔑視我們的優越勁頭和城市做派。

definition: to put on an attitude/to pose
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
amiable and approachable (idiom); easy-going/modest and unassuming/(of writing) plain and simple/easy to understand
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
